alert.note: Alert for Greene; Guthrie (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 04 at 5:43PM CDT until April 04 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL POLK...SOUTHEASTERN GREENE...NORTHWESTERN MADISON... SOUTHEASTERN GUTHRIE...SOUTHWESTERN BOONE...NORTHEASTERN ADAIR AND DALLAS COUNTIES... At 543 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Redfield, or 6 miles southwest of Adel, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Dallas Center, Minburn, Granger, Woodward and Bouton. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 89 and 114. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central, south central, southwestern and west central Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
